channel.title: Sebastiaan Westheim on Westhes
channel.description: Recent content in Sebastiaan Westheim on Westhes

item.title: Pathfinding
item.description: WIP A* pathfinding Github - Pathfinding Variants Modified Depth-First search algorithm with heuristic iterating over a few paths.

item.title: Procedural terrain generation
item.description: Like many around my age, I grew up when minecraft was still a brand new thing. Inspired by it’s grand and amazing worlds I wanted to create something like it for the longest time. During one of my courses at Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences (AUAS) we were tasked to create a procedurally generated object. While this was only meant to be a simple object, I quickly became invested in this technology.

item.title: About
item.description: Background Back in 2011 a younger me pondered about his future, wondering what he would do after finishing college. At the time I had yet to know that a path of game-development and software-engineering lay ahead of me. In 2012 I made my first steps towards becoming a game-developer by studying game development at the Grafisch lyceum Rotterdam. Over the course of 4 years this would be my introduction to programming, modeling, and various other software skills.

item.title: Contact
item.description: In case you would like to contact me, you can reach me through one of the following channels: Platform URL Github https://github.com/Westhes LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/sebastiaan-westheim/
